text:
Hey Everyone,
I'm struggling to get the HubSpot cookie notice to work on WordPress. We have GTM that, once the accept button is clicked, is added to the HubSpot page (blog, landing, etc), but the same doesn't seem to work on a WordPress site. Do we need to go down a different route?

Hi Everyone,
Im running into an issue with the HubSpot Quotes where my external cookie banner is showing up on the quote link which makes sense. But it’s also visible on the PDF after you click on the download button. I can’t remember having this issue before so it seems like something changed. Does anyone know a solution for this? I can’t exclude the domain from the cookie banner because that would mean I would also exclude my regular Landing Pages.

<@U07E4MSH6BS> you should be able to edit the rules and domain where the cookie notice is shown under Settings > Privacy & Consent > Data Privacy & Consent. Rahter than 'all domains, ' it is easier to control by adding the domains you want it to show on and excluding the quote URL.
Yes, but the Quotes are being hosted on the same domain as our Landing Pages. So im not sure if thats possible without buying an extra domain specifically for the quotes
Ahhh, yes your correct, in that instance, I think you need to show the cookies

Greetings! Neither of those. That is a Meta limitation. It means that when you register a WhatsApp Business Account for your business, you, as the business entity, can register up to 25 phone numbers that represent your business, from which to send and receive messages . It doesn't have anything to do with contacts in HubSpot.

Hi team,

I am trying to fetch contact associated company records in the email module using the crm_associations function, it works fine if we use a static ID for a contact in crm_association function, but if we use 'contact.hs_object_id' to fetch values dynamically then it stops working in email, do you know why we have this issue? What I was thinking is HubSpot added security on standard objects but I would like to confirm
Thanks Eric!! knowing that, I will start the implementation as soon as I can.

Howdy partners,
I am trying to using HubSpot's CMS/CLI extension in VSCode and after installing all dependencies (`npm install @hubSpot/cli@latest`), I am still unable to use `hs init` or any other command with "hs" as I receive the error: "hs: The term 'hs' is not recognized as a name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or executable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again."
I've tried reinstalling nodejs/npm with no luck. I've tried googling this and cant find any fix that has worked for me. Doesnt anyone have an idea of any possible fix?

Hi! I am trying to connect an app to HubSpot so our leads collected will go directly into HubSpot. They are requesting an endpoint url, which leadflow requires. Does anyone know where I would find my accounts endpoint URL?
Edit: Leaving my post up for any others, but I used the program "Everything" to search for where the npm folder was at, then added that to my system's path. Fixed the issue for me.
